## What does this PR do?

- example: [This PR adds my name in `README.md`](https://github.com/expressjs/express/pulls?q=is%3Apr+is%3Aclosed+README)

## Your personal checklist

- [ ] (**REQUIRED**) I have read and understood this statement, to its fullest extent:

> I understand that if my code in this PR is suspected of vibing too hard, to the point that [I do not even comprehend what it writes](https://hackerone.com/reports/2823554), and/or [failed to explain](https://hackerone.com/reports/2871792) what it is, this PR will be declined, and I will be banned from future contributions organization-wide.
>
> In case you don't know:
> - The first example does not even use `curl`.
> - The second example just cite a generic buffer-overflow, not even a report.

- [ ] (**REQUIRED**)  I have the authority to perform this PR, either on my own behalf or my current employer.

- [ ] I have used appropriate [closing keyword](https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/writing-on-github/working-with-advanced-formatting/using-keywords-in-issues-and-pull-requests#linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) for related issues and/or PRs.
